page.title: 20TOURISM
page.content: PEOPLE VISITING APPLEDORE SEE A TYPICAL KENTISH VILLAGE, THE PEACEFUL STREET LINED WITH PICTURESQUE HOUSES. THE PUBS ARE BUSY DURING THE SUMMER, WITH THE TOURISTS EATING LUNCH OUTSIDE. . KEEN FISHERMEN VISIT THE CANAL REGULARLY, AND FISHING COMPETITIONS ALSO TAKE PLACE.SOME FISHERMEN CAMP OVERNIGHT ON THE RIVER BANK.THERE IS A FIVE -VAN LOCATION ALONGSIDE THE CANAL. THE CHURCH AND HISTORICAL BUILDINGS ARE A NATURAL DRAW TO TOURISTS AS IS THE NATURAL BEAUTY OF THE RURAL SCENERY HIGHTENED BY THE JUXTAPOSITION OF THE VILLAGE ASTRIDE THE MARGIN OF WEALD AND MARSH.
